sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of political event occurring in a country
message_1: What is the probability that a randomly chosen person from a country will vote for a certain political party if that party has historically received 45% of the total vote in the country during previous elections? Assume that the voting behavior of people is independent and identically distributed (i.i.d.) from one election to another.
message_2: If the voting behavior of people is independent and identically distributed (i.i.d.) from one election to another, and the party has historically received 45% of the total vote in the country during previous elections, then the probability that a randomly chosen person from the country will vote for that political party is 45% or 0.45.
